723-d-05-23-06-GMRC.Narrative: GMRC 263 WAS HEADING FROM RUTLAND  TO BELLOWS FALLS. AFTER WE (ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR PASSED KELLY'SCROSSING THERE WAS AN IMMEDIATE JOLT FOLLOWED, ALMOST SIMUTANIOSLY BY AIR DUMPING ON TRAIN.  WHEN IWALKED THE TRAIN I FOUND CAR #27 IN THE TRAIN WITH REAR  TRUCKS DERAILED, 3 EMPTY COVER HOPPERS OVER THE EMBANKMENT, A LOADED 106 CAR ON ITS SIDE OBSTRUCTING THE ROAD BAD AND SEVERAL MORE CARS DERAILED AND TIES AND RAIL TORN UP.  PRIOR TO THE MISHAP POSTED SPEEDS WERE OBSERVED, NOTHING UNUSUAL DETECTED PRIOR TO MISHAP.  ABOVE NARRATIVE WRITTEN BY CONDUCTOR. INVESTIGATION CONCLUDED THAT A STIFF TRUCK IN CAR QGRY 85192 WAS THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT CONTRIBUTING FACTOR WAS HARMONIC ROCK AT 15 MPH.

47F050621-d-05-07-06-EJE.Narrative: CREW HAD PULLED THEIR DOUBLE OUT OF MIDDLE-5 USING SOUTH YARD LEAD AND GOT HEAD ROOM AT "THE ROCK" STOPPING AFTER THE HEAD END CLEARED THE CIRCUIT IN THE INTERLOCKING. CONDUCTOR LINED UP FOR MIDDLE-10AND INSTRUCTED ENGINEER TO SHOVE BACK IN ORDER TO MAKE THE JOINT ON MIDDLE-10.  ONCE ENGINEER STARTED SHOVING BACK, AXLES 3 & 4 OF THE EJE 88362 (TRAILING TRUCK) DERAILED ON TOP OF THE RUN-THROUGH SWITCH DUE TO THE SWITCH BEING GAPPED.  AFTER TRAVELING A SHORT DISTANCE ON THE GROUND WHEEL, L-3 HITTHE HEEL BLOCK ON THE SWITCH SHOVING THE RAIL BACK AND CREATING ENOUGH FORCE TO THROW THE OPEN SWITCH POINTS OVER THE REST OF THE WAY SO IT WOULD BE LINED FOR THE RUN-THROUGH.  THE LEAD AXLES ON THE FOLLOWING CAR, AXLES 1 & 2 OF EJE 88327 THEN STARTED DOWN THE RUN-THROUGH BUT GOT COMPLETELY PULLED OFF THE RAIL BY THE CARS AHEAD OF IT THAT WERE TRAVELING TOWARDS THE MIDDLE YARD.   THE TRAILING AXLES OF SAID CAR, AXLES 3 & 4 OF THE 88327, THEN TRAVELED DOWN THE RUN THROUGH AND EVENTUALLY ROLLED THE NORTH RAIL OVER DUE TO THE FORCES GENERATED BY THE CUT GOING DOWN TWO DIFFERENT TRACKS, THUS CAUSING WHEELS R-3 & 4 TO DROP INTO THE DIRT WHILE WHEELS L-3 & 4 RODE WEB OF THE ROLLED RAIL.  THE FINALDERAILED CAR EJE 88559 HAD WHEELS L-1 & 2 SLIP OFF THE HEAD OF THE RAIL AND START RIDING ON THE WEBOF THE ROLLED RAIL, AS WELL AT WHICH POINT THE MOVEMENT STOPPED.

CONDUCTOR THEN LINED THE SWITCH AND WHILE WALKING UP NOTICED THE 2 NORTH CARS MOVING AWAY FROM THEIR TRAIN ACCOUNT THEY FAILED TO COUPLE.  THE CARS ROLLED AWAY AND THEN THE LEAD CAR - GATX 67482, A LOADED TANK OF SLURRY STRUCK CNA 412385.  A BOX CAR OF PULP SITTING ON THE MAIN LINE.  APPROXIMATELY 200 GALLONS OF SLURRY LEAKED.  NON-HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE.  THERE WAS NO DAMAGE TO THE TRACK AND NO CARS WERE DERAILED IN THE IMPACT. THE CARS HAD ROLLED AWAY AND PICKED UP SPEED ON THEIR OWN AND AT THE TIME OF THE IMPACT WERE MOVING APPROX 28 MPH.  THERE WER NOT UNDER CONTROL OF REASONS THE DAMAGE WAS AS EXTENSIVE TO THE CARS AS IT WAS.

196710-d-05-28-06-SOO.Narrative: ASSIGNMENT GH-31 WAS PULLING WEST (REVERSE DIRECTION NORMAL TO HUMPING) & NOTED THE CP 522245 WAS DRAGGING AIR HOSE & WHAT APPEARED TO BE BRAKE RIGGING ON THE NORTH SIDE. GH-31 WAS STOPPED & HUMP YARDMASTER ADVISED THAT IT LOOKED LIKE THE CP 522245 HAD LOST IT'S EAST TRUCK ON THE LEAD.  INSPECTION FOUND A TRUCK SITTING BY ITSELF ON THE LEAD & ONE SET OF WHEELS APPROX 40' EAST OF THE TRUCK. THE OTHER SET OF WHEELS REMAINED UNDER THE CP 522245 & KEPT IT SUPPORTED UNTIL IT REACHED THE TOP OF THE HUMP (APPROX 250' FROM WHERE TRUCKS WERE FOUND). MKT 10043  WAS ALSO FOUND WITH EAST TRUCK  DERAILED AS A RESULT OF DEBRIS FROM THE CP 522245.  GH-31 HAD AHOLD OF TRACK CT16 (1 LOCOMOTIVE PLUS 43 CARS).THE CP 522245 WAS THE 40TH CAR (TRAIN POSITION 41) & MKT 100413 WAS THE 42ND CAR (TRAIN POSITION 43).  A NUMBER OF HUMP RETARDERS WERE DAMAGED. INVESTIGATION FOUND THE CP 522245 HAD A WORN FRICTION PLATE ON EAST TRUCK WHICH APPEARED TO HAVE BEEN MISSING FOR SOME TIME, APPARENTLY AS A RESULT OF A STIFF TRUCK. A MECHANICAL INSPECTION DETERMINED THAT ALTHOUGH IT WAS KNOWN THAT CP 522245 WAS DEFECTIVE, THAT THIS WOULD NOT HAVE BEEN A FACTOR IN THE DRAILMENT, THIS LEFT THE ONLY FACTOR TO BE SPEED ATTHE TIME OF THE INCIDENT.  DURING THIS TYPE OF MOVEMENT, THE ACCURACY OF ANALOG SPEED RECORDERS ONA LOCOMOTIVE DOES NOT PERMIT AN ACCURATE READING AS A RESULT OF THE SLOW SPEED REQUIRED (UNDER 10 MPH).  THE SPEED INDICATED CAN VARY BY SEVERAL MILES AN HOUR DURING SUCH A RESTRICTED MOVEMENT. AS A R

196444-d-05-09-06-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 398-080 SUCCESSFULLY PASSED OVER THE MP 383.9 TRACKSIDE DETECTOR AT 0940 HOURS, THEN MET TRAIN293-08 AT EMRICK, ND (MP 374) AT 1020 HOURS WHERE THEY RECEIVED A GOOD ROLL-BY ON BOTH SIDES BY 293-08'S CONDUCTOR & CONDUCTOR TRAINEE. THE TRAIN RECEIVED ANOTHER GOOD ROLL-BY ON THE NORTH SIDE AT MP365.0 BY A WELDING CREW. A BURNED OFF JOURNAL OF THE NORTH WHEEL (L1) 4TH AXLE (#332) OF RAILCAR NAHX 465896 (80TH CAR, LOAD OF WHEAT, BEHIND THE ENGINES) WAS DISCOVERED AT MP 362.7 BY ES MANAGERS THAT WERE HI-RAILING NEAR CARRINGTON AHEAD OF TRAIN 398-080.  WHEN ES MANAGERS HEARD RADIO TRANSMISSION OF CREW TELLING THE DISPATCHER THEY 'LOST THEIR AIR AND SAW FIRES BEHIND THEIR TRAIN' THEY WENT BACK TO THE AREA OF THE FIRES AND DISCOVERED A TOTAL OF FOUR (4) PIECES OF BROKEN JOURNAL, WHICH INCLUDED THE 'ROSE BUD' (THE MAIN PART OF THE AXLE/JOURNAL THAT BECAME OVERHEATED AND CAME APART). THE TRAIN HAD CONTINUED EAST AT 43 MPH WITH THE NAHX 465896'S AXLE #332 BEING SUPPORTED BY THE OTHER AXLEON THE TRUCK AND KNUCKLE.  IT CONTINUED TRAVELING THIS WAY TO MP 359.25 (APPROXIMATELY 3.5 MILES) WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO AN EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION.  ABOUT 500 FEET PRIOR TO MP 359.25, THE WESTEND OF RAILCAR NAHX 465896 DROPPED DOWN FORCING AXLE #332 OUT FROM UNDER THE CAR & INTO THE NEXT RAILCAR (CP 384882) CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE PIN LIFTER, BRAKE RIGGING, AND AIR BRAKE PIPE WHICH ACTIVATEDTHE EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION. THE TRAIN CAME TO A STOP AFTER RE-COUPLING ITSELF, AND ONLY THE WE

R0525601-d-05-25-06-RBMN.Narrative: CREW WAS SHIFTING CARS BETWEEN THE MAIN TRACK AND THE "M-Y LEAD."   THE CONDUCTOR ATTEMPTED TO COUPLE TO A CAR SITTING ON THE LEAD BUT THE COUPLING WOULD NOT GO TOGETHER DUE TO THE CURVATURE OF THE TRACK.  THE CONDUCTOR ATTEMPTED TO SHOVE THE STANDING CAR BACK WITH THE KNUCKLES CROSSED TO GET THE CAR ONTO THE STRAIGHT SECTION OF TRACK.  WHILE SHOVING, A VERTICAL SPLIT HEAD DEFECT IN THE RAIL FRACTURED AND THE CARS BEGAN TO DERAIL.  THE CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE THE COMBINATION OF THE EXTRA LATERAL FORCE EXERTED BY THE CROSSED COUPLERS WHICH PLACED EXTRA LATERAL FORCE ON THE PRE-EXISTING RAILDEFECT (WHICH WAS ON THE OUTSIDE RAIL IN A SLIGHT CURVE) CAUSING THE RAIL TO BREAK AND RESULTING INTHE DERAILMENT.

721-d-05-26-06-CLP.Primary Accident Cause: Cross level of track irregular (not at joints)
721-d-05-26-06-CLP.Contributing Accident Cause: Cross level of track irregular (at joints)
721-d-05-26-06-CLP.Accident Cause: Cross level of track irregular (not at joints)
721-d-05-26-06-CLP.Narrative: ON 5-26-06 OUR CLP 264 WAS HEADING WEST TOWARDS WHITEHALL WITH 87 CARS 29 LOADS AND 58 EMPTY CARS.AS THE CREW PULLED SOUTH DOWN THE CP'S CONTROLLED SIDING, THE TRAIN'S AIR PUTTING THEM INTO EMERGENCY AT 0320 HOURS.  UPON INVESTIGSTION THE CONDUCTOR FOUND TWO EMPTY COVERED HOPPERS CARS ON THE GROUND, NCUX 30238 AND DME 51245. THESE CARS WERE THE 67TH AND 69TH CARS IN THE TRAINS CONSIST.  ONE OF THE CONDUCTORS WALKED BACK TO SEE WHERE THE POD (POINT OF DERAILMENT) WAS, HE WALKED BACK APPROXIMATELY ONE MILE, AND STILL HADN'T FOUND WHERE THE CARS WENT OFF THE RAIL.  THE TRAIN CREW NOTIFIED OUR DISPATCHER AT 0340 HOURS ABOUT THE SITUATION AND THEN THE CP TRAIN DISPATCHER ABOUT THE DERAILMENT AND TOLD THEM TO HOLD ALL TRAINS UNTIL MAINTENANCE PEOPLE COULD MAKE A DAMAGE ASSESSMENT TO THE TRACKS.  UPON INVESTIGATION WE FOUND THAT THE POD WAS AT MILE A81.05, WHICH IS ON A CURVE.  THE CURVE DEVELOPED A PROFILE WITH A 3-1/2" CROSS LEVEL PROMBLEM IN IT, AND WHEN THE COVERED HOPPER (NCUX 30238) WENT OVER THAT SPOT WITH THE LOADED GONDOLA CAR IT TWISTED THE HOPPER AND WALKER THE LEAD WHEEL OF THE HOPPER OVER THE HIGH RAIL IN THE CURVE.  THE LEAD WHEEL ON THE GROUND FOLLOWED ALONG THE RAIL FORAPPROXIMATELY 4 MILES, THEN IT WAS DRAGGED THROUGH THE TWO CP MAIN LINE SWITCHES AT CP 77, THIS IS WHERE THE SECOND CAR WENT ON THE GROUND FROM THE FORCE OF THE CAR ALREADY ON THE GROUND.  THE TRAIN THEN PROCEEDED DOWN THE CONTROLLED SIDING WITH BOTH CAR ON THE GROUND AND CAME TO A STOP APPROXIMATEL

050606-d-05-06-06-AGCR.Narrative: 12 CARS WERE PARKED ON TRACK #1 BY BASE PILE.  IT HAD RAINED THE NIGHT BEFORE AND IT STARTED TO RAINHARD AT 0700 ON 5/6/06.  AT 8 AM THE BASE PILE TURNED TO MUD AND SLID ONTO THE CARS.  THE MUD COVERED THE CAR'S WHEEL'S UP TO THE BEARINGS.  THE 12 CARS ARE SP 466844, UP 40395, SP 466908, UP 38270,IPSX 78794,SPTX 481277, SPTX 481239, SPTX 481305, SP 465640, SP 465331.
